title: Improve component recycling by media type
description:
## Goal

Improve performance and memory usage with the new recycler list by reusing the Activity components grouped by media type.

The first implementation just reuses the activity component for all posts, this will create and destroy Images and Video players depending on the post type. If we set the type by media, all posts with videos will be rendered using the same instances, reducing the creation and destruction of video players.

## What needs to be done

Redefine the FeedList's getType by activity media type

## QA

Videos should work as usual


## UX/Design

none

## Personas

General improvement of the UX

## Experiments
none


## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Videos should work as usual
- [ ] Check if there is issues by video playing recycling

title: Video component issues with new recycle feed
description:
### Summary

The MindsVideo component doesn't support recycling. It has stable references to the entity passed so it doesn't change.

When an instance is recycled and rendered with other properties it plays the original video instead of the new one.

We need to refactor it to allow changing the entity and resetting all the video player properties and preloading.

### Steps to reproduce

- Scroll on the new feed implementation and some videos seem to be repeated.

### Platform information 
Both

### What is the current *bug* behavior?

Repeated videos on the feed

### What is the expected *correct* behavior?

The component should render the new video

### Relevant logs and/or screenshots

-

title: Build console to manage Superminds
description:
<!---
Please read this!

The Definition of Ready (DoR) can be found at https://developers.minds.com/docs/handbook/how-we-work/#definition-of-ready-dor

Before opening a new issue, make sure to search for keywords in the issues
filtered by the "Type::Feature" label and verify the feature you're about to submit isn't a duplicate.
--->

## Goal

<!---
Clearly outline the goal of the issue and why we are doing it
--->
- Create management console for users to easily accept and respond to Supermind requests or reject them


## What needs to be done

<!---
Clearly detail what needs to be done to achieve the goal set out above
--->


## QA

<!---
Consideration is given to how the issue will be demoed and tested prior to being deployed
--->


## UX/Design

<!---
Sufficient wireframes have been presented and understood by the development team. Full mockups are not required and re-usable components are encouraged.
--->

*Note: All design links below refer to the web UI.*

**[Supermind Console Prototype](https://www.figma.com/proto/thrGepQAxmcMGB7MoEEckM/Supermind?page-id=287%3A5127&node-id=1045%3A20853&viewport=4819%2C-9298%2C1&scaling=min-zoom&starting-point-node-id=1045%3A20853)**

* The SuperMind (console) is accessible via the `More Menu` within the main navigation.
* Users will also be directed here from email and push notifications.
* This SuperMind console is separate from the Boost console.
  * This console displays only the incoming requests [Requests received](https://www.figma.com/file/thrGepQAxmcMGB7MoEEckM/Supermind?node-id=319%3A12073)
  * And outgoing requests [Requests sent](https://www.figma.com/file/thrGepQAxmcMGB7MoEEckM/Supermind?node-id=338%3A12739)
* The settings icon contained within the above designs will link directly to the SuperMind settings (within the Settings Area).

**Requests Received**

* A user may either reply to a request, or choose to reject it.
* A producer has \[72 hours\] to respond to a request.
* Any expired request will disappear from `Requests Received`
* Requests are ordered from new -> old.
* Each request will also display any meta data relevant to the request.
  * Offer amount
  * Twitter post
  * Content type: Text, Video, Image, Remind.
* If the user clicks reject, funds are refunded to the consumer and a notification sent (As detailed within notification)
* Where the user clicks reply, the composer is launched.
  * Note: If the is the users first-time replying to a SuperMind request, they will need to read and agree to the relevant terms of user.
  * After doing so, they’ll then be directed to the composer.
  * If there’s there are specific content requirements, this could be communicated within the placeholder copy. (e.g. video required).
* Workflow for the above detailed here -> [Accept request workflow with T&Cs](https://www.figma.com/proto/thrGepQAxmcMGB7MoEEckM/Supermind?page-id=287%3A5127&node-id=319%3A12073&viewport=857%2C575%2C0.13&scaling=min-zoom&starting-point-node-id=319%3A12073)

title: Allow decimal in subscriber counts
description:
### Summary

Currently, if you have 1100 subscribers, it will read 1k subscribers - I believe this happens until you reach 1500, which makes it read 2k (looking at existing examples).

It would be good if we could show this as 1.1k - at least in the lower thousands.

### Steps to reproduce

See a channel such as https://www.minds.com/bitman007
That has subscribers in the low thousands.

### Platform information 

Likely platform-agnostic, happening on the front-end.

### What is the current *bug* behavior?

We don't provide much definition on how many subs a user has when they first enter the thousands.

### What is the expected *correct* behavior?

Up for discussion. On the "about" page it shows the actual number - but on the user's channel, it doesn't. I personally think it should probably be to  1 decimal place - 1.1k / 1.2k up to 10000.

### Relevant logs and/or screenshots

Check front task https://gitlab.com/minds/front/-/issues/4792

### Possible fixes

title: Mobile Automation: Add Profile test cases
Use Friendly Captcha to detect spam votes
description:
## Goal

This change is aimed at reducing the volume of spam votes on Minds.

## What needs to be done

Execute Friendly Captcha for all engagements that contribute to Engagement scores. (Currently, I think that's just upvotes.)

The Friendly Captcha should execute in the background, and not require the user to click anything to execute beyond the initial engagement click.

If a Friendly Captcha fails, display a toaster message to the user communicating that their engagement looks like spam.



- In order to implement this task it will be necessary to find a way to use the JS part of the friendly captcha and remove the need for the webview


## QA

<!---
Consideration is given to how the issue will be demoed and tested prior to being deployed
--->


## UX/Design

(Need to define what happens when Friendly Captcha fails. If we're discounting the engagement, we need some transparency for users who may be engaging legitimately but still triggering a captcha failure.)

## Personas

- Users who earn rewards: By discounting inauthentic engagements, engagement rewards for authentic users should increase
- Token manipulators: By discounting inauthentic engagements, manipulators will have fewer tools for gaming the engagement rewards.

## Experiments

I suggest rolling this out not as an A-B experiment, but in phases where we can understand the impact.

- Phase 1: Execute friendly captchas on all upvotes and log the results, without impacting engagement scores. Use captcha-failed events to analyze the effectiveness of the method on identifying inauthentic engagement, and 
- Phase 2: If we're satisfied with the effectiveness, begin discounting engagements that fail the Friendly Captcha. At this point, we need to transparently communicate to users when it's failed.

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Authentic engagements (upvotes) function as they do now -- there is no change to the user experience.
- [ ] Inauthentic engagements trigger a toaster message disclosing the captcha fail.
- [ ] Inauthentic engagements are otherwise still recorded.
- [ ] Visualise to users that their vote is in progress
- [ ] Still submit failed events
- [ ] Snowplow 'proof of work' context to be recorded. Success boolean.
- [ ] Add to elastic metrics (like user account quality score does)
- [ ] Add configuration variable to difficult ramp
- [ ] Use feature flags
- [ ] Spec tests

## Definition of Ready Checklist

- [ ] Definition Of Done (DoD)
- [ ] Acceptance criteria
- [ ] Weighted
- [ ] QA
- [ ] UX/Design
- [ ] Personas
- [ ] Experiments

title: Refactor FeedList component with FlashList
description:
## Goal

Improve performance and memory consumption.

The new FlashList component recycles the item components and has a very low JS thread FPS impact compared with the FlatList

## What needs to be done

Reimplement the FeedList component:

- [ ] Move header to the body (FlashList doesn't support sticky on the header)
- [ ] Check how to implement the component injection (Probably we will need getItemType)

## QA

The new component should work correctly on Newsfeed, Channel screen, Groups, and Discovery.

## UX/Design

No changes are required at the beginning of the implementation but we may need some design decisions over changes needed to keep or improve the performance.  

## Personas

It will improve the overall UX of the user, mostly on low-end device

## Experiments

None


## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] The new component should work correctly on Newsfeed, Channel screen, Groups, and Discovery.

title: Reset Password link: Issue with Opening the App
description:
<!---
Please read this!

Before opening a new issue, make sure to search for keywords in the issues
filtered by the "T - Bug" label and verify the issue you're about to submit isn't a duplicate.
--->

### Summary

1. Reset Password link doesn't work if the app is already open in the background.
2. Reset Password link will require users to log in again by navigating them to `WelcomeScreen`

### Steps to reproduce

## Scenario 1

1. Make sure the app is open in the background
2. Make sure you have received a reset password link
3. Click the link (it should open the app)
4. Notice that "Create a new password" modal won't pop up

## Scenario 2
1. Make sure the app is closed
2. Make sure you have received a reset password link
3. Click the link (it should open the app)
4. Notice that you're in the Welcome Screen and if you dismiss the "Create a new password" Modal you'll have to log in again

Note: in Scenario 2, if you close and open the app, you're still logged in (the session won't be lost)

### Platform information

All

### App version

Latest

### What is the current *bug* behavior?

As described above

### What is the expected *correct* behavior?

If you click the link and the app is open, it should open the "Create a new password". And if the app is closed, it should not navigate to WelcomeScreen, and user should b able to dismiss the Modal and continue to use the app without having to log in again

### Relevant logs and/or screenshots

title: Mutual Channel Subscriptions [mobile]
description:
## Goal

Give channels validation by surfacing any mutual subscriptions to the user. It is a reasonable to believe that users should be more likely to subscribe where their peers are already subscribers. 


## What needs to be done

- [x] Provide designs
- [x] Review designs
- [ ] Get agreement on the logic detailed within the acceptance criteria
- [ ] Run by one of the mobile devs to get any useful feedback


## QA

TBC


## UX/Design

- [Prototype Mobile](https://www.figma.com/proto/WMrvIQMlt2aiXcMsedfvGZ/Channel-%5BMobile%5D?page-id=0%3A1&node-id=1%3A1482&viewport=4810%2C973%2C1&scaling=min-zoom&starting-point-node-id=1%3A1482)

- https://www.figma.com/file/WMrvIQMlt2aiXcMsedfvGZ/Channel-%5BMobile%5D?node-id=1%3A1482


## Personas

TBC


## Experiments

* Not sure if we need to run any experiments here @markryansallee - The basic hypothesis is that users will be more likely to subscribe to channels that their peers already to subscribe to. This is nonetheless a low-risk feature, so perhaps it would be best simply to gather metrics on subscriptions where there mutual subscriptions are displayed, and make the feature available to all. 


## Acceptance Criteria

* Displays only where there are one or more mutual subscriptions (a mutual subscription is where a channel is subscribed to by a channels that the current user subscribes to)
* Will not display when a user is viewing their own channel
* Will display whether a user is subscribed / not subscribed to the channel being viewed.
* A maximum of three avatars will display at any one time.
* Tapping anywhere on the component will launch a modal with all relevant channels.
* Copy: The area here is quite limited so we need to be selective with the language.
  * \[1 mutual subscription\] @channelA is subscribed
  * \[2 mutual subscriptions\] @channelA and @channelB are subscribed
  * \[3 mutual subscriptions\] @channelA, @channelB and 1 other is subscribed
  * \[4+ mutual subscriptions\] @channelA, @channelB and 2 others are subscribed etc.

- [ ] Copy implementation of https://gitlab.com/minds/front/-/merge_requests/1962 (pay attention to language)

## Definition of Ready Checklist

- [ ] Definition Of Done (DoD)
- [x] Acceptance criteria
- [ ] Weighted
- [ ] QA
- [x] UX/Design
- [ ] Personas
- [ ] Experiments

title: Implement new workflow on the CI
description:
## Goal

Improve and simplify our development/release workflow.

 - A more streamlined workflow
 - Single development branch
 - Simplify patch releases
 - Simple code push patch releases

![Screen_Shot_2022-05-20_at_11.35.22](/uploads/46d43e1b08fbeae83fa43bad275e3b87/Screen_Shot_2022-05-20_at_11.35.22.png)

![Screen_Shot_2022-05-20_at_11.36.00](/uploads/9b452ca27e5bfec59e6baa43e1f35cad/Screen_Shot_2022-05-20_at_11.36.00.png)

![Screen_Shot_2022-05-20_at_11.36.49](/uploads/15c87dd1c9e6ecb5f216db8ae1fe1435/Screen_Shot_2022-05-20_at_11.36.49.png)

![Screen_Shot_2022-05-20_at_11.42.51](/uploads/6531e493881ce29a07565324c1a3be1d/Screen_Shot_2022-05-20_at_11.42.51.png)

## What needs to be done

- Create a script to get the version from the APK or gradle.properties file/
- Ideally, move the iOS build to gitlab
- Create a fast lane step to deploy directly to the app store (upload_to_app_store)
- Change the CI to match the new workflow:
  - MR branches: `feat/*` `chore/*` `fix/*` `refactor/*`
    - Spec tests
    - e2e?
    - Review app build (dev tools enabled by default)
    - Deploy to Browserstack for QA
  - Development branch: `development`
    - Spec tests
    - e2e?
    - Production build
    - Deploy to Browserstack, S3, TestFlight?
  - Master branch: `master`
    - Spec tests
    - Production build
    - Deploy to the Android Stores and Appstore
  - Codepush patch branchs: `patch/*` (Only JS patch)
    - Spec tests
    - e2e?
    - Production build
    - Deploy to Browserstack, S3, TestFlight
    - CodePush release for both platforms
  - Native patch branchs: `release/x.x.1`
    - Spec tests
    - e2e?
    - Review app build (dev tools enabled by default)
    - Deploy to Browserstack for QA, S3, TestFlight (manual)

## QA

TBD

## UX/Design

none


## Personas

It will simplify our workflow allowing us to 

## Experiments

none

- [ ] Experiments

## Goal

Increase content engagement and activity in the mobile app by sending a daily push notification to app users promoting an unseen activity post from their top feed.

## What needs to be done

- Automate a daily push notification personalized per user, promoting an unseen activity post from their top feed
- Time the push notification at the time of day that user is typically active in the app
- Add an option to the Notifications setting that allows users to disable this notification (`Top posts`)
- Be able to measure how often these push notifications are used to launch or engage with the app

title: Plan and define required changes for a more streamlined workflow
description:
## Goal

Define the workflow and the required changes to provide a more streamlined development/release workflow for mobile.

 - Have an automatic build for the current dev branch for both platforms (Currently available for Android only)
 - Ideally, have one single development branch 
 - Ideally, move iOS CI to gitlab
 - Remove current detox e2e from circle CI
 - Add e2e to GitLab CI using the new implementation (Browserstack real devices)
 - It should include codepush patch release

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Documented new workflow
- [ ] Create new tasks for required changes

## Definition of Ready Checklist

- [ ] Acceptance criteria
- [ ] Weighted

title: Change codepush updates priority
description:
### Summary

Currently, the common updates are installed immediately (causing a restart) and the mandatory updates after the app is sent to the background.

That should be the opposite:
 - Mandatory: inmindatelly
 - Common: After restart

title: Uploads fail on iOS when the app is moved to the background
description:
### Summary

The upload (requests) are canceled when the app is moved to the background (iOS)

### Steps to reproduce

- Open the composer
- attach a large media
- move the app to the background before it finishes the upload

### Platform information 

iOS

### What is the current *bug* behavior?

Network request failed

### What is the expected *correct* behavior?

It should continue the upload in the background

### Relevant logs and/or screenshots

![IMG_AD9BAA3BD269-1](/uploads/6b3fb097ce4665f2863b0b3c582ec614/IMG_AD9BAA3BD269-1.jpeg)

### Possible fixes

Vydia/react-native-background-upload can be useful

title: App stack re-renders while switching user causing some hooks to be fired
description:
### Summary
The main screen of the app (AppStack) is rendered a few times while switching users.

This causes some hooks for example to be fired with the old and new user sessions in a very close window.

In order to prevent some weird race conditions, we should disable the app stack while switching users

### Steps to reproduce

Switch users
- Social compass hook is called with both users

### Platform information 
Both

### What is the current *bug* behavior?
- App stack re-renders while switching users

### What is the expected *correct* behavior?

- App stack should render again when the switch finishes


### Possible fixes

make the AppStack return null while switching users

description:

### Summary

Some posts don't get deblurred on Android

### Steps to reproduce

- use android
- use the latest version (4.24.0)
- Make sure your latest feed contains an image post
- Notice that the blurhash of that image doesn't get removed

Android

I just described above

Blurhash should only appear when the image hasn't been loaded yet. When the image loads it should get removed. And it shouldn't appear at all if the image was previously loaded.

description:

title: Throw a better error message when video upload fails
description:
### Summary

Currently, a network request error is displayed when internet goes down during uploading a video on Minds.

Reported via Testing Channel. 

### Steps to reproduce

1. Open minds app.
2. Go to composer.
3. Upload a video.
4. Make sure internet connectivity goes bad.

### Platform information 

iOS & Android

### What is the current *bug* behavior?

Throws network error.

### What is the expected *correct* behavior?

Should throw a better error message and ask user to try again with internet so it is clear. Wording to be confirmed with @michaelfbradley

title: Unable to Filter content by Date Range
description:
### Summary

When filtering content by date range, user is brought back to "All" as the filter option after inputting the date range and hitting "Done". Range is never accepted, therefore filter is never applied.

### Steps to reproduce

Log in --> filter --> select a valid date range (start and end dates are both in the past or present)

### Platform information 

iPhone and Android app

### What is the current *bug* behavior?

Date range filter is never applied, filter behavior reverts to "all". The radial button never moves.

### What is the expected *correct* behavior?

Radial button should move to the selected range, indicating a successful application of the filter.

### Relevant logs and/or screenshots

![iPhone_SetRange](/uploads/f72edd7874b82b2959e16a68360b33c2/iPhone_SetRange.mp4)

### Possible fixes

(If you can, link to the line of code that might be responsible for the problem)

title: Add codepush release creation steps on the CI
description:
## Goal

Be able to do patch releases in a quick way using code push and only pressing a button on the CI

## What needs to be done

We need to create a new CI stage that will be available for the patch/x.y.z branches.

It should include
 - Spect tests
 - Manual job to deploy to code push `staging`
 - Manual job to deploy to code push `production`

## QA

It should be tested until the staging step.

- Create a patch/x.y.z branch with some changes
- Run the staging deploy on the CI
- Check on appcenter that the bundle is uploaded

Extra test for the entire flow (in-app update)

- Install the stanging version of the app (The latest Minds-release-x_y_z.apk)
- It should update silently and the changes should be visible after restarting the app

## UX/Design

-

## Personas

Developers: Improve our release flow
Users: receive update faster and silently

## Experiments

-


## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] It should add the required steps to the CI
- [ ] It should do the bundle for each platform in a separate job and in parallel (In case one fail we can run it again)

title: Update report categories
description:
<!---
Please read this!

The Definition of Ready (DoR) can be found at https://developers.minds.com/docs/handbook/how-we-work/#definition-of-ready-dor

Before opening a new issue, make sure to search for keywords in the issues
filtered by the "Type::Feature" label and verify the feature you're about to submit isn't a duplicate.
--->

## Goal


The goal is to streamline the report modal by clarifying categories and removing duplicate and/or unused entries.

## What needs to be done

Report categories should be updated to reflect the chart in the following section. Below is a list of changes:

**Text-only changes**

1. Change 'pedophilia' to 'sexualization of minors'
2. Change 'Encourages or incites violence' to 'Incitement to violence'
3. Change 'Impersonates' to 'Impersonation'
4. Change 'Copyright' to 'Intellectual Property Violation'
5. Change 'Token manipulation' to 'Inauthentic engagement'
6. Change "Sex trafficking" to "Trafficking"

**Removals**

Remove the following categories:

1. Trademark infringement (because it is merged with IP violation)
2. Incorrect use of hashtags (because it does nothing)

**Modifications**

Under 'Intellectual Property Violations' (formerly 'Copyright') we need to link to the Zendesk DMCA form instead of saying to email to copyright@minds.com.

https://support.minds.com/hc/en-us/requests/new?ticket_form_id=360003221852

![image](/uploads/3468e4dcc934af01a792d1680dbaf7da/image.png)

## QA

<!---
Consideration is given to how the issue will be demoed and tested prior to being deployed
--->

Minimal QA: make sure reporting under the new labels generates the correct report.

Check emails.

## UX/Design

<!---
Sufficient wireframes have been presented and understood by the development team. Full mockups are not required and re-usable components are encouraged.
--->

...

## Personas

<!---
Who does this user impact and why
--->

This change impacts typical Minds users who make reports.

## Experiments

<!---
Experiments are not required, but it should be made clear if one is expected. If experiments are required, the hypothesis should be outlined.
--->

No experiments are needed.

## Acceptance Criteria

<!--
Everyone should be able to understand what is expected to be delivered
--->

- [ ] Labels are correctly changed for users on the report modal

## Definition of Ready Checklist

- [ ] Definition Of Done (DoD)
- [ ] Acceptance criteria

- [ ] Experiments
